Heart Rate is almost accurate when compared to pulse oximeter.(conditions apply tht you do not check it on plain surface)3. Watch clarity, watch faces, touch screen, build quality, button scroll function, weather  ..... all above are superb , excellent.Cons:1. BP monitoring is not accurate, it always tell near to normal reading (even for my parent who are hypertension patients .... Sometimes it is for good also that psychological it makes them happy that they are fine ... But also dangerous for genuine cases)2. Sports mode - Cycling -- rubbish function ....you just switch on the cycling mode and sit on bed ... It will start the timing and start increasing calories burnt ...totally foolish... The app should be made functional to start cycling mode from mobile (as this watch does not contain GPS support)3. When you switch on sports mode you cannot see the time on smart watch ... It will keep on showing your sports mode. Hell function ... Sports mode should run at backend nd user should be allowed to see time.4. Callories burnt count is not good when started sports mode - badminton ... It is only count callories burnt according to steps taken while playing badminton....More functions should be added like racquet speed etc. Etc.5. If you sleep in a day time ... It does not do the sleep tracking.6. DaFit app needs some improvements like gpa support for cycling etc. Curently it only support outdoor cycling.7. When watch is placed on bed or hard surface it tells spo2, heart rate, BP reading which needs to be improved through some fixes from app in watch.I hope you like this review.. I will give 3.5 star to this watch. Above average ...not so great watch as per functions nd it's accuracy... But yes it is good watch for style nd few pros I described above otherwise NOT SO MUCH RECOMMENDED
